Setting.Name: filename
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --filename file: a unix socket filename to listen on.

Setting.Name: port
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --port N: N is the tcp port to listen on.

Setting.Name: address
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --address addr: addr is the ip address to listen on.

Setting.Name: root
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --root rootdir: the server changes to this directory before anything else.

WebDescription.p: The server changes to this directory before anything else.

Setting.Name: appconfigfile
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --appconfigfile FILENAME: adds application definitions from the XML configuration file. See sample configuration file that comes with the server.

WebDescription.p: Adds application definitions from the XML configuration file. See sample configration file that comes with the server.

Setting.Name: appconfigdir
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --appconfigdir DIR: adds application definitions from all XML files found in the specified directory DIR. Files must have '.webapp' extension

WebDescription.p: Adds application directories from all XML files found in the specified directory. Files must have ".webapp" extension.

Setting.Name: applications
Setting.ConsoleDescription:
--applications APPS: a comma separated list of virtual directory and real directory for all the applications we want to manage with this server. The virtual and real dirs. are separated by a colon. Optionally you may specify virtual host name and a port.
[[hostname:]port:]VPath:realpath,...
Samples: /:. the virtual / is mapped to the current directory.
/blog:../myblog the virtual /blog is mapped to ../myblog
myhost.someprovider.net:/blog:../myblog the virtual /blog at myhost.someprovider.net is mapped to ../myblog
/:.,/blog:../myblog Two applications like the above ones are handled.

WebDescription.p: A comma separated list of virtual directory and real directory for all the applications we want to manage with this server. The virtual and real dirs. are separated by a colon. Optionally, you may specify the virtual host name and a port.

Setting.Name: nonstop
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --nonstop: don't stop the server by pressing enter. Must be used when the server has no controlling terminal.

Setting.Name: verbose
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --verbose: prints extra messages. Mainly useful for debugging.

Setting.Name: maxconns
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --maxconns: the maximum number of concurrent connections.

WebDescription.p: The maximum number of concurrent connections to accept before rejecting.

Setting.Name: maxreqs
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --maxreqs: the maximum number of concurrent requests.

WebDescription.p: The maximum number of concurrent requests to allow before rejecting.

Setting.Name: multiplex
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --multiplex: allow multiplexing requests on the connections.

WebDescription.p: Allow multiplexing requests on the connections

Setting.Name: configfile
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --configfile FILE: a file to load the configuration from.

Setting.Name: editconfig
Setting.ConsoleDescription: --editconfig: adds a configuration application to the server.

Setting.Name: configapp
Setting.ConsoleDescription:
--configapp: specifies the configuration application in the format:
[[hostname:]port:]VPath
